newsitem.title: BELGIUM: British official may head EU cereal/sugar division.
newsitem.headline: British official may head EU cereal/sugar division.

text.p: British official Russell Mildon is being considered to run the European Commission's cereals, oilseeds, sugar and other crop units, Commission sources said.
The job includes chairing weekly meetings of the EU cereals management committee which awards grain export subsidies or imposes taxes.

Mildon, who was one of the architects of the 1992 EU-U.S. Blair House oilseeds deal which helped pave the way to the GATT world farm trade agreement, is currently in charge of fruit and vegetables, wine, tobacco and other specialised crops.

The European Commission's Spanish director of cereals and other crops, Jose Manuel Silva, is lined up for promotion to become a deputy director general of agriculture, in place of another official, Fernando Mansito, who has left.
